alert.note: Alert for Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 3:13AM EST until December 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (8.1 to 8.3 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Southern Berkeley County including Daniel Island. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water may cover some roads and encroach on yards on Daniel Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 11:17 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Tidal Berkeley SC MLLW Categories - Minor 8.0 ft, Moderate 8.5 ft, Major 9.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.2 ft, Moderate 2.7 ft, Major 3.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/11 AM 8.2 2.4 2.4 N/A Minor 17/11 PM 4.3 -1.5 -0.5 N/A None 18/12 PM 5.1 -0.7 -0.5 N/A None 19/01 AM 3.9 -1.9 -1.1 N/A None 19/01 PM 5.0 -0.8 -0.3 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
